author: 0xraino
content: I don't have a specific question, I see why the historical fee api would be useful. In discussing the behavior of any gas price oracle option I have a feeling someone's going to say "why don't we do this thing instead?" and then there'll be silence because the consumers of the api can't opine.

author: carl0000
content: We (status) are aiming for the simplest possible implementation initially. On the last call it was discussed that we'd be able to fetch the base fee of the pending block and a priority fee based on the last X blocks (e.g. lowest 10%ile of last 2 blocks). Having these calls be super lightweight would be brilliant for everybody. Historical api would be useful during times of congestion so we can give solid gas estimates

author: sky.cactus
content: On the wallet call the weak consensus in my head (possibly me just hearing what I want to hear) was that clients shouldn't be oracles, they should be data providers.  We want to provide enough data so that any wallet can write their own oracle in a few lines of code with data sourced from a single request (not have to track block history).
